intro: Geniostoma lopeziifolium, commonly known as the Lopeziifolium leaf geniostoma, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus, and is characterized by its showy, often pink or red flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and has hairy, lance-shaped leaves. Its botanical features include a woody stem, palmate leaves, and capsule-like fruits that release seeds when mature.
